paper.title: A Name-free Account of Action Calculi

author.org: Department of Computer Science, University of Edinburgh, The King's Buildings, Edinburgh, EH9 3JZ, UK

paper.venue: Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science
paper.abstract: Abstract Action calculi provide a unifying framework for representing a variety of models of communication, such as CCS, Petri nets and the Ï€-calculus, within a unified setting. A central idea is to model the interaction between actions using names. We introduce a name-free account of action calculi, called the closed action calculi, and show that there is a strong correspondence between the original presentation and the name-free presentation. These results show that, although names play an important presentational role, they are in some sense inessential.
